item.title: Leadership Lessons from Parenting
item.description: Learning comes from all activities, and interacting with children actually teach you many great lessons applicable to leadership. Or is it the other way around? That’s a debate for another day. Whether you have kids or not, those lessons are relevant for anyone in a leadership position or looking for it. When you say you’ll do something, do it. Best way to gain trust, respect and credibility is to do what you’ve told you’ll do.
